decks.notes: This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on using efficient and powerful creatures like Anafenza, Siege Rhino, and Fleecemane Lion to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Hero's Downfall to control the board and protect its threats. The deck utilizes cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Wingmate Roc for additional value and resilience. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent casting of spells and to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly. The deck focuses on constant pressure and speed, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Foundry Street Denizen to quickly build up a strong board presence. Cards like Stoke the Flames and Lightning Strike help to finish off opponents or eliminate threats on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast tempo and push for a quick victory by overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining card advantage and maintaining board control. This is achieved through a combination of targeted removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful dragons like Thunderbreak Regent and Stormbreath Dragon. The deck also utilizes cards like Silumgar, the Drifting Death and Haven of the Spirit Dragon for additional control and value. By effectively disrupting the opponent's game plan and deploying powerful threats, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck is focused on overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by a mix of burn spells and buffs. The key strategy is to fill the board with cheap creatures like Foundry Street Denizen and Monastery Swiftspear, then use spells like Atarka's Command and Stoke the Flames to deal damage and finish off the opponent quickly. The deck aims to be relentless and unrelenting, constantly putting pressure on the opponent and forcing them to react to the constant stream of threats.

The primary focus of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board using cards like Crux of Fate and Foul-Tongue Invocation while also applying pressure with powerful dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Dig Through Time allows the player to dig for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with a mix of removal and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The strategy is to play efficient threats like Siege Rhino, Fleecemane Lion, and Rakshasa Deathdealer while using cards like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize to remove any obstacles in the way. The deck also includes versatile cards like Abzan Charm and Dromoka's Command for added flexibility. By maintaining a strong board presence and disrupting the opponent's plans, this deck aims to close out the game quickly and decisively.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures such as Seeker of the Way, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Thunderbreak Regent to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of burn spells like Crackling Doom and Draconic Roar helps to remove threats and clear the way for attacks. Thoughtseize provides disruption by stripping key cards from the opponent's hand, while Kolaghan, the Storm's Fury provides a powerful finisher. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also providing flexibility with cards like Haven of the Spirit Dragon.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy threats and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Siege Rhino, Courser of Kruphix, and Den Protector. It also includes powerful removal spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall to control the board. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while generating value from cards like Mastery of the Unseen and Deathmist Raptor. The inclusion of Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides a powerful finisher. Ultimately, the deck combines aggression and resilience to overwhelm opponents.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly overwhelm opponents with a mix of powerful creatures and combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Den Protector, the deck can consistently put threats on the board while also having the flexibility to protect its creatures with Valorous Stance and Dromoka's Command. The aggressive curve of creatures such as Fleecemane Lion and Courser of Kruphix allows the deck to apply pressure from the early turns and maintain board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counter spells, removal, and card draw to out-value the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with powerful dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Silumgar, the Drifting Death. By carefully managing resources and manipulating the opponent's plays, the deck aims to take control of the game and win through card advantage. The inclusion of versatile cards like Dig Through Time and Thoughtseize helps maintain consistency and adaptability in various matchups.

The main concept of this Mardu Control deck is to utilize a combination of powerful dragons and token-generating spells to maintain board control. By playing strong creatures like Thunderbreak Regent and Butcher of the Horde, along with spells like Crackling Doom and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to control the battlefield and eliminate threats efficiently. The deck also includes burn spells like Stoke the Flames and Draconic Roar to deal direct damage to opponents. Overall, the key strategy is to establish dominance on the battlefield while keeping the opponent's options limited.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ashcloud Phoenix, Boon Satyr, and Stormbreath Dragon to pressure the opponent early on. Cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid help ramp up mana and provide some extra durability. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence, utilizing cards like Surrak, the Hunt Caller and Crater's Claws to finish off the game quickly. The deck has a solid mana base with a mix of Forests, Mountains, and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.
